subsc: Compulsory pension and unemployment insurance,Telecommunications,Power,General industry and trade sector,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fiscal Consolidation Credit Project
            will support fiscal sustainability through structural, and
            institutional reforms, to positively impact public finances.
            Consistent with the Country Assistance Strategy, and
            conditional on its successful implementation, the project
            will lay the foundation for future support to the
            country's economic growth, and reform agenda. Project
            actions will improve budgetary management, particularly in
            clearing domestic payment arrears, will contain the public
            sector wage bill, implement a parametric reform to improve
            the viability of the existing pay-as-you-go pension system,
            and, strengthen the financial management of key public
            enterprises that provide infrastructure services, thus
            initiating a process of sector liberalization, and
            privatization. Although risks include weak institutional
            capacity, resistance by interest groups, and slippages in
            the macroeconomic program, these will be mitigated by
            focusing on few key reforms through the provision of
            technical assistance, and, by implementing reforms in
            collaboration with interested parties, including workers and
            employers. As per the potential downturn in macroeconomic
            stabilization, the project will complement the policy
            actions supported by the International Monetary Fund, by
            helping the authorities meet such targets.
